metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0360 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
file_open in Tryton 3.x and 4.x through 4.2.2 allows remote authenticated users with certain permissions to read arbitrary files via a "same root name but with a suffix" attack. NOTE: This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1242.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tryton-server - 4.2.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tryton-server package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-2').
